com.stormpath.sdk.oauth

Interface ScopeFactory


  • public interface ScopeFactory
    A ScopeFactory allows you to define application-specific scopes (aka 'permissions') granted to a successfully authenticated Account making an OAuth request. For example: 
     // Your implementation knows how to inspect an Account resource and return
 // a collection of OAuth scope strings (permissions) that should be considered as assigned to that account for the
 // duration of the request:
 ScopeFactory myScopeFactory = new MyScopeFactory();

 OauthAuthenticationResult result = application.authenticateOauth(httpRequest)
     .using(myScopeFactory)
     ...
     .execute();

    Specifying a ScopeFactory is optional. It is necessary only if you want to perform OAuth authorization (access control) checks after the OAuth caller is authenticated.

    Since:
    1.0.RC

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<String> createScope(AuthenticationResult result, Set<String> requestedScopes)
      Returns the set of Application-specific granted scopes (permissions) for a successfully authenticated account making an OAuth request.

    • Method Detail

      • createScope

        Set<String> createScope(AuthenticationResult result,
                      Set<String> requestedScopes)
        Returns the set of Application-specific granted scopes (permissions) for a successfully authenticated account making an OAuth request.

        Implementations will likely inspect the authenticated account (via result.getAccount()) and the requestedScopes and return a set of the scopes that are actually granted. That is, an implementation is free to return whatever scopes it wishes to consider 'granted' to the specified account, regardless of what may be requested.

        Parameters:
        result - the authentication result reflecting the already-authenticated account that made the OAuth request.
        requestedScopes - the set of Application-specific permissions requested in the authentication request.
        Returns:
        the actual set of Application-specific scopes/permissions granted to the account.
